physical_examinations.vital_signs: Serum calcium: 1.57 mmol/L (6.28 mg/dL); PTH: 2.2 pmol/L
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Hypocalcemic infant had low serum adjusted-calcium; elevated serum phosphate and inappropriately normal serum PTH. No clinical or biochemical features of Di George or HDR syndromes.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Serum calcium increased into normal range after IV calcium infusions and remained normal at discharge.
Developed hypocalcemic seizures at 7 days of age.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Presented with focal seizures affecting upper limbs.
